introduction.p: Find the value of the following annuities at the indicated times. Assume interest rates are effective with the same period as the payments.

task.p: An annuity has K_1 = 100, K_2 = 200, and K_3 = 350 with \iota = 6.5\%. Value at time t = 7.
An annuity has K_1 = 50, K_2 = 100, K_3 = 575, and K_4 = 200 with \iota = 3\%. Value at time t=-3.
An annuity has K_t = 250 for t = 1, \ldots, 5, and K_t = 500 with \iota = 2\%. Value at time t=0.

introduction.p: Find the missing payment as indicated. Round to the nearest whole number.

task.p: There are four payments in an annuity immediate: K_1 = 375, K_2 = 600, and K_3 = 400. The effective periodic interest rate is \iota = 4\%, and the present value is 1299.60. Find K_4.
There are five payments in an annuity immediate: K_1 =700, K_2 = 550, K_4 = 600, and K_5 = 900. The effective periodic interest rate is \iota = 5\%, and the accumulated value is 3430.99. Find K_3.
There are ten payments in an annuity immediate: K_t = 25 for t = 1,\ldots, 9, and K_{10} = X+25. The effective periodic interest rate is \iota = 3.5\%, and the present value is 916.83. Find X.
There are six payments in an annuity immediate, and K_t = 100 for all t EXCEPT for t=3. The effective periodic interest rate is \iota = 2\%, and the accumulated value is 1294.067. Find K_3.

There are ten payments in an annuity immediate, and K_t = 175 for t = 1,\ldots, 5. In addition, K_t = K is constant for t = 6, \ldots, 10. The effective periodic interest rate is 5.5%, and the present value is 1564.14. Find K.

introduction.p: Find the accumulated value of the following annuities-immediate whose payments form a geometric progression. Unless otherwise indicated, assume interest rates are effective and both interest and growth rates have the same period as the payments.

task.p: The first payment is 1200, and payments increase by 3%. There are 15 payments, and \iota = 4\%.
The first payment is 11,500 and payments decline by 2%. There are 10 payments, and \iota = 5\%.
The first payment is 5000, and payments increase by 3.5%. There are 12 payments, and \iota = 3.5\%.
The first payment is 1.5, and payments increase by 6%. There are 8 payments, and \iota = 2.5\%.
The first in a sequence of monthly payments is 1500. Every year, the payments increase by 3%. The effective monthly interest rate is 0.75%. The payments continue for 5 years.

introduction.p: Find the present value of the following annuities-immediate whose payments form a geometric progression. Unless otherwise indicated, assume interest rates are effective and both interest and growth rates have the same period as the payments.

task.p: The first payment is 5000, and the payments increase by 2%. There are 20 payments, and \iota = 3.5\%.
The first payment is 750, and the payments decrease by 0.5%. There are 30 payments, and \iota = 1\%.
The first payment is 2.5, and the payments increase by 1.5%. There are 12 payments, and \iota = 2\%.
The first payment is 60,000, and the payment increase by 3%. There are 15 payments, and \iota = 3\%.
The first in a sequence of monthly payments is 1250. Every year, the payments decrease by 4%, and the effective annual interest rate is 5%. The payments continue for 12 years.

introduction.p: Find the value at the indicated time.

task.p: The first payment of a 30-year monthly annuity is 8500. Each payment decreases by 0.5%. The effective annual interest rate is 9.5%. Find the value 2 years after the final payment.
The first payment of a 5-year, semi-annual annuity is 500. Each payment increases by 2%. The effective monthly interest rate is 0.0075. Find the value 1 year prior to the first payment.

A share of stock will pay dividends every quarter for five years, starting two years from today. The first dividend is 5, and each dividend grows by 1.5%. The nominal interest rate, compounded semiannually, is 8%. Find the value of the dividends today.

The payout on a life insurance plan is 3500 monthly for 20 years, with annual cost-of-living increases of 1.5%. The effective monthly interest rate is 1%. Find the value six months after the final payment.

introduction.p: Find the theoretical values of the following stocks.

task.p: The stock pays an annual dividend of 4.5. The effective annual interest rate is 2.25%.
The stock pays an annual dividend of 7. The effective annual interest rate is 2%.
The stock pays a quarterly dividend. The first dividend (three months from now) will be 3.5. Each dividend will grow by 2%. The effective annual interest rate is 12%.
The stock will pay a quarterly dividend. The first dividend will be paid 1 year from now, and will be 10. Each dividend will grow by 3%. The effective quarterly interest rate is 4%.
The stock will pay a quarterly dividend. The first dividend (three months from now) will be 8. The dividends will grow annually by 2.5%. The effective annual interest rate is 12%.

introduction.p: Find the missing value as indicated. Unless otherwise indicated, assume interest rates are effective and both interest and growth rates have the same period as the payments.

task.p: An annuity-immediate with 12 payments has a present value of 11,849.77. If the payments grow by 3%, and \iota = 5\%, find the first payment.
An annuity-immediate has a present value of 135,452.52. The first payment is 9500 and each payment grows by 6%. Find the number of payments if \iota = 9\%.
A perpetuity-immediate has a present value of 100,000. The first payment is 500, and each subsequent payment grows by 2%. Find \iota.
A perpetuity-immediate has a present value of 6,000. The first payment is 150, and grows by a rate of R\%. The effective interest rate is \iota = 4.5\%. Find R.
A five-year annuity-immediate has monthly payments of K which increase annually by 2.5%. Using an effective annual interest rate of \iota = 4\%, the accumulated value is 83,325.58. Find K.

introduction.p: For each of the following, create a timeline.
For each of the following, (i) create two timelines, one for each term, (ii) combine the two into a single timeline, and (iii) Describe the result of the combination financially.
Find the value of the following annuities as indicated.

task.p: An annuity-immediate starts with a payment of 100. Payments decline by 5 until the payment amount reaches 0, and then stop. The effective periodic interest rate is \iota = 3\%. Find the present value.
An annuity-due with 12 payments starts with a payment of 1200. Payments grow by 100. The effective periodic interest rate is 2%. Find the accumulated value.

An annuity-immediate with 10 annual payments starts with a payment three years from now of 15,000. Payments grow by 1,000 each year. The effective annual interest rate is \iota = 5\%. Find the present value.
A perpetuity-immediate has payments of 25, 50, 75, and so on. If \iota = 2.5\%, find the present value.

An annuity-immediate starts with a monthly payment of 2500, and declines by 100 until the payment reaches 0 and then stops. The effective monthly interest rate is 0.75%. Find the accumulated value 6 months after the final nonzero payment.

introduction.p: Find the missing value as indicated.

task.p: An annuity makes quarterly 60 quarterly payments, with the first payment 3 months from now. The payments grow by 500 each quarter. Using an effective quarterly interest rate of 2.5%, the present value is 391,795.81. Find the amount of the first payment.

An annuity makes monthly payments for 10 years. The first payment is 100, and the payments grow by a constant amount. Using an effective monthly interest rate of 1%, the accumulated value immediately following the last payment is 78,023.21. Find the amount by which each payment increases.

A perpetuity makes annual payments, starting one year from now. The first payment is 50, and each subsequent payment grows by 50. Using an interest rate \iota with \iota > 0, the present value is 3,740.11. Find the effective annual interest rate.
